item.title: Should whether you live depend on where you live? A Stance on Death Penalty.
item.description: Although most, if not all, American citizens deem equality, liberty and respect of life as fundamental aspects of any society, they seem not to be on the same page regarding the prospect of death penalty. Under the New Federalism which governs American politics, the federal system gives considerable power to the individual states over what policies to make and abide by. Although it may seem rudimentary to hark back on the era where a national standard is set for every policy, one may consider it necessary for the aspect of death penalty.
